{\em i\+\_\+path\mbox{[}out\mbox{]}} & Vector to store the resulting shortest path indices in the i direction. \\
\hline
{\em j\+\_\+path\mbox{[}out\mbox{]}} & Vector to store the resulting shortest path indices in the j direction. \\
\hline
{\em elevation\+\_\+ratio} & Balance factor between absolute elevation and elevation difference in the cost function. Should be in the range \mbox{[}0, 1\mbox{[}. \\
\hline
{\em distance\+\_\+exponent} & Exponent used in the distance calculation between points. A higher exponent increases the cost of elevation gaps, encouraging the path to minimize elevation changes and reduce overall cumulative elevation gain. \\
\hline

\doxysubsubsection{\texorpdfstring{quilting\_blend()}{quilting\_blend()}}
{\footnotesize\ttfamily \mbox{\hyperlink{classhmap_1_1Array}{Array}} hmap\+::quilting\+\_\+blend (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{const std\+::vector$<$ const \mbox{\hyperlink{classhmap_1_1Array}{Array}} \texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*} $>$ \&}]{p\+\_\+arrays,  }\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{structhmap_1_1Vec2}{hmap\+::\+Vec2}}$<$ int $>$}]{patch\+\_\+base\+\_\+shape,  }\item[{float}]{overlap,  }\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{array_8hpp_a91ad9478d81a7aaf2593e8d9c3d06a14}{uint}}}]{seed,  }\item[{bool}]{patch\+\_\+flip = {\ttfamily true},  }\item[{bool}]{patch\+\_\+rotate = {\ttfamily true},  }\item[{bool}]{patch\+\_\+transpose = {\ttfamily true},  }\item[{float}]{filter\+\_\+width\+\_\+ratio = {\ttfamily 0.25\mbox{\hyperlink{distance__transform_8cpp_abcb9259cf91bfd25e92a72cdf18c285e}{f}}} }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}



Synthesize a new heightmap by stitching together small patches from a list of input heightmaps. 

This function creates a new heightmap by stitching patches from a set of input heightmaps, similar to {\ttfamily quilting}, but the patches are blended together. The blending options include flipping, rotating, and transposing patches, with smoothing based on the overlap between patches.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em p\+\_\+arrays} & Vector of pointers to input heightmaps. \\
\hline
{\em patch\+\_\+base\+\_\+shape} & Shape of the patches to be used. \\
\hline
{\em overlap} & Overlap between patches, in the range \mbox{]}0, 1\mbox{[}. \\
\hline
{\em seed} & Random seed number for patch placement. \\
\hline
{\em patch\+\_\+flip} & Allow flipping of patches (up-\/down, left-\/right). \\
\hline
{\em patch\+\_\+rotate} & Allow 90-\/degree rotation of patches (for square patches). \\
\hline
{\em patch\+\_\+transpose} & Allow transposition of patches (for square patches). \\
\hline
{\em filter\+\_\+width\+\_\+ratio} & Ratio of filter width to overlap length for smoothing. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
\doxylink{classhmap_1_1Array}{Array} Resulting synthesized heightmap.
\end{DoxyReturn}

{\footnotesize\ttfamily \mbox{\hyperlink{classhmap_1_1Array}{Array}} hmap\+::quilting\+\_\+expand (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{const \mbox{\hyperlink{classhmap_1_1Array}{Array}} \&}]{array,  }\item[{float}]{expansion\+\_\+ratio,  }\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{structhmap_1_1Vec2}{hmap\+::\+Vec2}}$<$ int $>$}]{patch\+\_\+base\+\_\+shape,  }\item[{float}]{overlap,  }\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{array_8hpp_a91ad9478d81a7aaf2593e8d9c3d06a14}{uint}}}]{seed,  }\item[{std\+::vector$<$ \mbox{\hyperlink{classhmap_1_1Array}{Array}} \texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*} $>$}]{secondary\+\_\+arrays = {\ttfamily \{\}},  }\item[{bool}]{keep\+\_\+input\+\_\+shape = {\ttfamily false},  }\item[{bool}]{patch\+\_\+flip = {\ttfamily true},  }\item[{bool}]{patch\+\_\+rotate = {\ttfamily true},  }\item[{bool}]{patch\+\_\+transpose = {\ttfamily true},  }\item[{float}]{filter\+\_\+width\+\_\+ratio = {\ttfamily 0.25\mbox{\hyperlink{distance__transform_8cpp_abcb9259cf91bfd25e92a72cdf18c285e}{f}}} }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}



Synthesize a new heightmap by expanding the input heightmap and stitching patches. 

This function generates a larger heightmap by expanding the input heightmap and stitching patches based on the given parameters. The expansion ratio determines the new size of the heightmap, and the function includes options for flipping, rotating, and transposing patches. The output can be either the same shape as the input or expanded based on the given ratio.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em array} & Input heightmap to be expanded. \\
\hline
{\em expansion\+\_\+ratio} & Ratio by which to expand the heightmap (e.\+g., 2 for doubling the size). \\
\hline
{\em patch\+\_\+base\+\_\+shape} & Shape of the patches to be used. \\
\hline
{\em overlap} & Overlap between patches, in the range \mbox{]}0, 1\mbox{[}. \\
\hline
{\em seed} & Random seed number for patch placement. \\
\hline
{\em keep\+\_\+input\+\_\+shape} & If true, the output heightmap retains the input shape. \\
\hline
{\em patch\+\_\+flip} & Allow flipping of patches (up-\/down, left-\/right). \\
\hline
{\em patch\+\_\+rotate} & Allow 90-\/degree rotation of patches (for square patches). \\
\hline
{\em patch\+\_\+transpose} & Allow transposition of patches (for square patches). \\
\hline
{\em filter\+\_\+width\+\_\+ratio} & Ratio of filter width to overlap length for smoothing. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
\doxylink{classhmap_1_1Array}{Array} Resulting synthesized heightmap.
\end{DoxyReturn}

{\footnotesize\ttfamily \mbox{\hyperlink{classhmap_1_1Array}{Array}} hmap\+::quilting\+\_\+shuffle (\begin{DoxyParamCaption}\item[{const \mbox{\hyperlink{classhmap_1_1Array}{Array}} \&}]{array,  }\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{structhmap_1_1Vec2}{hmap\+::\+Vec2}}$<$ int $>$}]{patch\+\_\+base\+\_\+shape,  }\item[{float}]{overlap,  }\item[{\mbox{\hyperlink{array_8hpp_a91ad9478d81a7aaf2593e8d9c3d06a14}{uint}}}]{seed,  }\item[{std\+::vector$<$ \mbox{\hyperlink{classhmap_1_1Array}{Array}} \texorpdfstring{$\ast$}{*} $>$}]{secondary\+\_\+arrays = {\ttfamily \{\}},  }\item[{bool}]{patch\+\_\+flip = {\ttfamily true},  }\item[{bool}]{patch\+\_\+rotate = {\ttfamily true},  }\item[{bool}]{patch\+\_\+transpose = {\ttfamily true},  }\item[{float}]{filter\+\_\+width\+\_\+ratio = {\ttfamily 0.25\mbox{\hyperlink{distance__transform_8cpp_abcb9259cf91bfd25e92a72cdf18c285e}{f}}} }\end{DoxyParamCaption})}



Synthesize a new heightmap by reshuffling patches of the input heightmap. 

This function generates a new heightmap by reshuffling patches of the input heightmap, effectively creating a new pattern while keeping the same shape as the input heightmap. The function includes options for patch flipping, rotating, and transposing.


\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em array} & Input heightmap to be reshuffled. \\
\hline
{\em patch\+\_\+base\+\_\+shape} & Shape of the patches to be used. \\
\hline
{\em overlap} & Overlap between patches, in the range \mbox{]}0, 1\mbox{[}. \\
\hline
{\em seed} & Random seed number for patch placement. \\
\hline
{\em patch\+\_\+flip} & Allow flipping of patches (up-\/down, left-\/right). \\
\hline
{\em patch\+\_\+rotate} & Allow 90-\/degree rotation of patches (for square patches). \\
\hline
{\em patch\+\_\+transpose} & Allow transposition of patches (for square patches). \\
\hline
{\em filter\+\_\+width\+\_\+ratio} & Ratio of filter width to overlap length for smoothing. \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
\begin{DoxyReturn}{Returns}
\doxylink{classhmap_1_1Array}{Array} Resulting synthesized heightmap with reshuffled patches.
\end{DoxyReturn}

This function flips the input array along the vertical axis, resulting in a left-\/to-\/right mirror image of the original array.

Applies a zoom effect to a 2D array with an adjustable center. 

This function scales the input 2D array by a specified zoom factor, effectively resizing the array\textquotesingle{}s contents. The zoom operation is centered around a specified point within the array, allowing for flexible zooming behavior. The function supports both periodic boundary conditions, where the array wraps around, and non-\/periodic conditions, where areas outside the original array bounds are filled with zeros.

\hline
{\em periodic} & If set to {\ttfamily true}, the zoom is periodic, meaning that elements moving out of the array bounds due to the zoom reappear on the opposite side. If {\ttfamily false}, areas outside the original array bounds are filled with zeros. The default is {\ttfamily false}. \\
\hline

The default center is \{0.\+5f, 0.\+5f\}. \\

\hline
{\em p\+\_\+noise\+\_\+y} & Optional pointer to a 2D array that contains y-\/direction noise to be added during the zoom operation. If provided, the noise values are applied to the y-\/coordinates of the zoomed array on a per-\/element basis. \\
\hline
{\em bbox} & Domain bounding box.\\
